availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Carter County, Kentuckky farmer. Kentucky native. Married Jane Scott. Father of Calvin H. Scott, Mary Scott, Louisa Scott, Johnson Scott, Sarah E. Scott, Winfield Scott, and John M. Scott.

bibl.p: Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Carter County, District 2, p. 242. Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Carter County, Olive Hill, p. 39. Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Carter County, Grayson, Precinct 3, p. 11. “CFP James W. Scott,” Find A Grave, May 29, 2016, memorial no. 163470959.
